parameter.value: Open an ontology from a URI
Undo the last set of changes
Collects together all loaded ontologies in a particular folder without modifying the originals
Exports inferred axioms as an ontology
Redo the last set of changes
Find an entity in the focused view
Create a new object in the selected view
Create a child of the selected object in the selected view
Create a sibling of the selected object in the selected view
Duplicates the current class. This copies the class, its superclasses and equivalent classes.
Converts the equivalent classes of the selected class to superclasses.
Converts the superclasses of the selected class to an equivalent class.

Adds a covering axiom to the selected class. If a class A has subclassses B, C and D then the covering axiom for A is the union class (B or C or D). This forces all instances of A to be a member of one of its subclasses.
Removes all owl:DifferentIndividuals statements and creates one owl:DifferentIndividuals statement containing all individuals. This only changes the active ontology.
Makes primitive sibling classes disjoint. All disjoint axioms are added to the current ontology.
View and edit the prefix value mappings
View, add and edit the ontology libraries
Shows the physical URIs from where currently loaded ontologies were obtained from
Refactor the ontology, or the selected class, property or individual
Deletes the selection in the focused view
Change the URI of the selected entity (rename)
Change the URI of the active ontology
Convert property assertion on class/individual puns to annotations
Converts any property assertions with a subject which is a pun to an annotation on the class which is punned
Coerce data property values into property range
Coerces any data property value into (to be typed by) the range of the data property
Splits subclass axioms in the active ontologies into more fine grained axioms. For example, A subClassOf (B and C) would be split into A subClassOf B, and A subClassOf C
Merges subclass axioms that have a common left hand side. For example, A subClassOf B, A subClassOf C would be merged into a single subclass axiom, A subClassOf (B and C).
Merge one or more ontologies into an existing or new ontology.
Shows the usage of the selected entity
Creates a class hierarchy from tab indented text, and inserts the new hierarchy into the existing class hierarchy at a specified position.
